Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
TO FUND PROJECTS THAT WILL BENEFIT AND ASSIST WORKING WOMEN, WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED AND MARGINALIZED WOMEN WORKERS WHO ARE PAID LOW WAGES AT WORK, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WOMEN OF COLOR, WOMEN WITH DISABILITIES, JUSTICE-IMPACTED WOMEN, INDIVIDUALS WHO IDENTIFY AS LGBTQ, MARGINALIZED WORKERS IN FEMALE-DOMINATED SECTORS HARD-HIT BY THE PANDEMIC, ETHNIC MINORITIES, IMMIGRANTS, WORKERS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY, OLDER ADULTS, AND WORKERS EXPERIENCING WORKPLACE HARASSMENT OR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES, HOMELESSNESS, OR CHRONIC POVERTY. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS FOA, "WOMAN" OR "WOMEN" IS TO BE INTERPRETED IN THE MOST INCLUSIVE MANNER, WITH PARTICIPANT ELIGIBILITY TO BE INCLUSIVE OF TRANSGENDER WOMEN AND NON-BINARY INDIVIDUALS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO REACH AND ASSIST THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF WOMEN WITHIN THE TARGET POPULATION.  DISSEMINATION OF EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION ACROSS MULTIPLE PLATFORMS, SUCH AS SOCIAL MEDIA, IN-PERSON OR VIRTUAL EVENTS, BROCHURES AND LEAFLETS, ONE-ON-ONE CONSULTATIONS, ETC, TO THE TARGET POPULATION.  RIGHTS AND BENEFITS ACTIVITIES TO HELP WOMEN ACCESS THEIR RIGHTS AND BENEFITS, EXECUTING A CLEAR, VIABLE PLAN TO IMPROVE BENEFITS TAKE-UP AND ENROLLMENT, DETER VIOLATIONS, IMPROVE COMPLIANCE, AND CONNECT/REFER WOMEN TO ADDITIONAL SERVICES, BENEFITS, AND ASSISTANCE, AS WELL AS TRAINING WOMEN TO BECOME BENEFITS NAVIGATORS OR PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITIES TO ENSURE WOMEN ACCESS THEIR RIGHTS AND BENEFITS.

DELIVERABLES
THE GRANTEE HAS SIX PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES THEY MUST STRIVE TO MEET:  1) NUMBER OF WOMEN WHO WILL BE REACHED THROUGH OUTREACH ACTIVITIES; 2) NUMBER OF WOMEN AND/OR SIZE AND TYPE OF THE AUDIENCE TO WHOM EDUCATIONAL INFORMATION WILL BE DISSEMINATED;
3) NUMBER OF WOMEN WHO WILL BE CONNECTED TO NAVIGATION SERVICES AND TO BENEFIT CALCULATOR SERVICES; 4) NUMBER OF WOMEN WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM RIGHTS AND BENEFITS ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING THOSE WHO GAIN ACCESS TO OR ENROLL IN BENEFITS, AND THOSE WHO ARE REFERRED TO ADDITIONAL SERVICES, BENEFITS, AND/OR LEGAL ASSISTANCE; 5) WHETHER AND TO WHAT EXTENT BEST PRACTICES OR SERVICES DEVELOPED UNDER THIS GRANT CAN OR WILL BE SUSTAINED BEYOND THE GRANT PERIOD; AND 6) ANY SYSTEMIC CHANGE ANTICIPATED TO RESULT FROM THE GRANT ACTIVITIES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
WORKING WOMEN, WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED AND MARGINALIZED WOMEN WORKERS WHO ARE PAID LOW WAGES AT WORK, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WOMEN OF COLOR, WOMEN WITH DISABILITIES, JUSTICE-IMPACTED WOMEN, INDIVIDUALS WHO IDENTIFY AS LGBTQ, MARGINALIZED WORKERS IN FEMALE-DOMINATED SECTORS HARD-HIT BY THE PANDEMIC, ETHNIC MINORITIES, IMMIGRANTS, WORKERS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY, OLDER ADULTS, AND WORKERS EXPERIENCING WORKPLACE HARASSMENT OR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SUBSTANCE ABUSE ISSUES, HOMELESSNESS, OR CHRONIC POVERTY. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS FOA, "WOMAN" OR "WOMEN" IS TO BE INTERPRETED IN THE MOST INCLUSIVE MANNER, WITH PARTICIPANT ELIGIBILITY TO BE INCLUSIVE OF TRANSGENDER WOMEN AND NON-BINARY INDIVIDUALS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
LITTLE TO NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY. MOST SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES ARE PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE GRANTEE.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
LITTLE TO NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY. MOST SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES ARE PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE GRANTEE.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO EMPLOYERS (WHICH MAY INCLUDE PUBLIC ENTITIES) AND LABOR UNIONS TO ENCOURAGE EMPLOYMENT OF WOMEN IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS (A/NTO).

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
NEW'S PROPOSED PROJECT LEVERAGES THE ORGANIZATION'S OTHER SOURCES OF FUNDING IN COMBINATION WITH WANTO TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF WOMEN SERVED THROUGH ITS PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING IN THE CONSTRUCTION AND BUILDING TRADES AND RAP PLACEMENT PROGRAMS DURING THE TWO-YEAR GRANT PERIOD. WITH WANTO FUNDING, NEW WILL BE ABLE TO EXPAND ITS WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS TO REACH UNDERREPRESENTED AND LOW-INCOME WOMEN AND TO INTEGRATE THEM INTO NEW YORK'S PANDEMIC ECONOMIC RECOVERY BY FURTHER ADVANCING TARGETED HIRES. RETENTION SERVICES FOR WOMEN PLACED WITH RAPS, INCLUDING INDIVIDUALIZED SUPPORTS AND GROUP WORKSHOPS AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES 

DELIVERABLES
WOMEN FROM UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES WILL ENROLL AND COMPLETE TRAINING, SECURE AND ACHIEVE HIGHER WAGE EMPLOYMENT, AND ACHIEVE ONE-YEAR POST-PLACEMENT RETENTION

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNDERREPRESENTED AND LOW-INCOME WOMEN IN NEW YORK CITY 
RAPS AND OTHER EMPLOYERS IN THE CONSTRUCTION AND BUILDING TRADES IN NEW YORK CITY 


SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO EMPLOYERS (WHICH MAY INCLUDE PUBLIC ENTITIES) AND LABOR UNIONS TO ENCOURAGE EMPLOYMENT OF WOMEN IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS (A/NTO).

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO HELP EMPLOYERS IDENTIFY, DEVELOP AND/OR OFFER TRAINING PROGRAMS SO WOMEN CAN DEVELOP SKILLS TO MEET THE EMPLOYERS' NTO WORKFORCE NEEDS; AND CREATE INCLUSIVE AND EQUITABLE WORK ENVIRONMENTS WHERE WOMEN CAN THRIVE. CONDUCTING MARKETING AND OUTREACH TO WOMEN FROM UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES TO ENCOURAGE THEM TO PURSUE NTOS AS VIABLE CAREER OPTIONS WITH HIGH-GROWTH AND HIGH-WAGE POTENTIAL. OFFERING ADDITIONAL TRAINING, WRAP-AROUND SUPPORTS, AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES (I.E. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE) TO ENSURE WOMEN CAN FULLY PARTICIPATE IN NTO TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AND ARE POSITIONED TO SECURE AND MAINTAIN NTO CAREERS LONG-TERM. 

DELIVERABLES
 150 WOMEN FROM UNDER-REPRESENTED COMMUNITIES WILL COMPLETE SKILLS TRAINING, SECURE HIGHER WAGE EMPLOYMENT, ACHIEVE MEASURABLE SKILLS GAINS AND COMPLETE ANCILLARY TRAINING. THREE COMMITTED EMPLOYERS WILL RECEIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TRAINING.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE WOMEN FROM UNDERREPRESENTED BACKGROUNDS, SUCH AS LOW-INCOME, DISABLED, IMMIGRANT, LGBTQ+, FORMERLY INCARCERATED, TRANSGENDER, AND WOMEN OF COLOR. ADDITIONAL BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMITTED EMPLOYER PARTNERS WHO WILL ENRICH THEIR WORKPLACES AND MAKE PROGRESS TOWARD DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION GOALS BY HIRING AND RETAINING WOMEN IN NTOS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO EMPLOYERS (WHICH MAY INCLUDE PUBLIC ENTITIES) AND LABOR UNIONS TO ENCOURAGE EMPLOYMENT OF WOMEN IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS (A/NTO).

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
INCREASE THE GENERAL AWARENESS OF NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS FOR 1,100 WOMEN THROUGH
INFORMATION SESSIONS, A REGIONAL BRANDING CAMPAIGN, AND INDUSTRY TOURS
DEVELOP AN INCLUSIVE RECRUITMENT NETWORK TO CONNECT WOMEN TO SKILLED CAREERS
GUARANTEE EMPLOYMENT INTERVIEWS FOR WOMEN ENROLLED IN THE TRAINING PROGRAMS
ENROLL WOMEN IN SKILLED CAREER TRAINING PROGRAMS
PROVIDE WRAPAROUND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO WOMEN WHO ENROLL IN TRAINING PROGRAMS
PROVIDE PERFORMANCE-BASED INCENTIVES TO WOMEN PARTICIPATING IN TRAINING PROGRAMS
PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO EMPLOYERS SEEKING TO INCREASE THE
PARTICIPATION OF WOMEN IN THEIR WORKFORCE
DEVELOP A SYSTEM OF SUPPORT GROUPS TO ENCOURAGE THE RETENTION OF WOMEN IN SKILLED
CAREERS
RESEARCH AND SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF RETENTION-FOCUSED BEST PRACTICES THROUGH
FOCUS GROUPS, SURVEYS, AND THE REVIEW OF EXISTING RESEARCH AND PRACTICE DATA.


DELIVERABLES
THE HRWC ESTIMATES THAT 80 PERCENT OF WISC PARTICIPANTS
WILL BE COMPLETE TRAINING PROGRAMS OF THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO PARTICIPATE IN
EMPLOYMENT INTERVIEWS AFTER TRAINING COMPLETION WILL BE EMPLOYED IN LOCAL INDUSTRIES. AT LEAST
PARTICIPANTS WHO COMPLETE TRAINING WILL ACHIEVE A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN WAGES AS A DIRECT
RESULT OF THEIR PARTICIPATION IN WISC.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNDERSTANDING THE INTERSECTIONAL NATURE OF INEQUITY IN THE HAMPTON ROADS COMMUNITY, WE ANTICIPATE THAT WISC PARTICIPANTS WILL LIKELY BE FACING AT LEAST ONE EQUITY-RELATED BARRIER, SUCH AS LOW-INCOME STATUS OR LACK OF TRANSPORTATION, AS THEY BEGIN THE PROGRAM. AS SUCH, THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES DO NOT STAND INDEPENDENT OF EACH OTHER. THE ANTICIPATED DEMOGRAPHIC BREAKDOWN OF TRAINING PARTICIPANTS WILL BE WOMEN, INDIVIDUALS OF COLOR, DISCONNECTED YOUTH WITH DIFFERING ABILITIES; VETERANS OR MILITARY SPOUSES. WOMEN REPRESENTING THE ABOVE CATEGORIES WILL RECEIVE GENERAL AWARENESS OF NON-TRADITIONAL OCCUPATION OPPORTUNITIES IN HAMPTON ROADS

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE HRWC WILL OUTSOURCE THE HIRING OF TWO FULL-TIME POSITIONS, WISC
NAVIGATORS, TO THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE WORKFORCE COOPERATIVE (CCWC) TO SUPPORT THE
EXPLORATION AND ENROLLMENT NEEDS OF WOMEN SEEKING TO ENROLL IN TARGETED TRAINING PROGRAMS AT
PAUL D. CAMP, THOMAS NELSON, AND TIDEWATER COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THEY WILL ALSO SUPPORT
REGIONAL OUTREACH AND RECRUITMENT EFFORTS, HELPING IDENTIFY AND ENCOURAGE WOMEN TO ENTER
TRAINING AND APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS FOR SKILLED TRADES. WISC NAVIGATORS WILL ALSO SUPPORT
PROGRAM COORDINATION, DATA COLLECTION, AND REPORTING

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO EMPLOYERS (WHICH MAY INCLUDE PUBLIC ENTITIES) AND LABOR UNIONS TO ENCOURAGE EMPLOYMENT OF WOMEN IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS (A/NTO).

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
 PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC AGENCIES, PROJECT OWNERS, CONTRACTORS, APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS AND UNIONS TO ENSURE THAT EQUITY IS EMBEDDED IN THESE INVESTMENTS, EXPANDING GENERAL AND TRADE SPECIFIC PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING AND STRENGTHENING THE ROLE THAT APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, UNIONS, AND CONTRACTORS PLAY IN INCREASING THE NUMBER OF WOMEN PREPARED TO ENTER THESE FIELDS. CREATE NATIONAL, REGIONAL AND LOCAL MENTORSHIP MODELS THAT SUPPORT WOMEN'S RETENTION THROUGH SUPPORT, GUIDANCE AND SKILL BUILDING TO ADVANCE IN SKILLED TRADE OCCUPATIONS. PROMOTE SUSTAINABILITY AND SCALING OF THE BEST PRACTICES LEARNED FROM THE PROJECT, BY HOSTING  INSTITUTES FOR INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS, TRADESWOMEN, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, AND STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES ON MAXIMIZING WORKFORCE EQUITY IN INFRASTRUCTURE, AND BUILDING MENTORSHIP MODELS TO ENSURE EQUITY FOR TRADESWOMEN.

DELIVERABLES
CWIT EXPECTS TO OFFER 4 SESSIONS OF PRE-APPRENTICESHIP ANNUALLY DURING THE GRANT PERIOD SERVING WOMEN. IN PHILADELPHIA WINC WILL SERVE WOMEN IN ITS TRADESWOMEN'S READINESS PROGRAM THROUGH LEVERAGED FUNDS. CWIT WILL ALSO RECRUIT AND PREPARE WOMEN FOR SUCCESS, PROVIDING CASE MANAGEMENT, PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE, MENTORSHIP AND PROVISION OF WRAP-AROUND SUPPORT SERVICES, WHILE THE APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS WILL DESIGN AND DELIVER CURRICULUM AND WORK TO PLACE SUCCESSFUL GRADUATES IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
 WOMEN AND PEOPLE OF COLOR WORKING IN THE TRADES AND ON PUBLICLY FUNDED INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS,

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
N/A

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) TO EMPLOYERS (WHICH MAY INCLUDE PUBLIC ENTITIES) AND LABOR UNIONS TO ENCOURAGE EMPLOYMENT OF WOMEN IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP AND NONTRADITIONAL OCCUPATIONS (A/NTO).

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS TA IN FIVE AREAS: (1) TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, EMPLOYERS, AND UNIONS TO INCREASE RETENTION AND DECREASE SYSTEMIC BARRIERS FOR WOMEN IN THE TRADES BY EXPANDING THE RISE UP WORKPLACE CULTURE TRAINING MODEL (2) TARGETED RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF UNDERSERVED FEMALE COMMUNITIES INTO CONSTRUCTION APPRENTICESHIPS (3) CREATION OF NEW PRE-APPRENTICESHIPS FOR WOMEN IN PREVIOUSLY UNSERVED LOCATIONS AND TRADES (4) EXPANSION OF EXISTING PRE-APPRENTICESHIPS FOR WOMEN BY INCORPORATING RISE UP CURRICULUM; AND (5) EXPANSION OF PROVEN RETENTION STRATEGIES INCLUDING MENTORSHIP AND SUPPORT GROUPS FOR WOMEN. EACH OF THESE FOCUS AREAS IMPACT THE EXPANSION OF APPRENTICESHIP AS WELL AS THE NUMBER OF WOMEN ENTERING AND SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING.

DELIVERABLES
THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE 350 UNDUPLICATED WOMEN THROUGH THE STATES OF WASHINGTON, OREGON, AND OKLAHOMA. THE PROJECT WILL CREATE TWO NEW PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM WITH A FOCUS ON RECRUITING UNDERSERVED WOMEN AS WELL AS THE EXPANSION OF 5 EXISTING PRE-APPRENTICESHIPS. THERE WILL ALSO BE A FOCUS ON THE EXPANSION OF THE RISE UP 4 EQUITY CONSTRUCTION WORKPLACE CULTURE PROGRAM BY SERVING OVER 80 APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, 25 PUBLIC ENTITIES, 100 CONTRACTORS, AND 15 UNIONS WITH ITS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
WOMEN THROUGH THE STATES OF WASHINGTON, OREGON, AND OKLAHOMA.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
A SUBAWARD WILL BE AWARDED TO OREGON TRADESWOMEN TO CONDUCT TA, RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION, PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING, AND MENTORING ACTIVITIES IN OREGON THE AMOUNT OF $254,769. AN ADDITIONAL SUBAWARD WILL BE MADE TO WOMEN ACCESSING NON-TRADITIONAL TRADES TO CREATE AND PROVIDE PRE-APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMMING AND RECRUITMENT OF WOMEN INTO PRE-APPRENTICESHIP

AWARD PURPOSE
AS STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES INCLUDING THE DEPARTMENTS OF TRANSPORTATION, COMMERCE, AND ENERGY ARE GEARING UP TO BREAK GROUND ON MAJOR PROJECTS FUNDED BY THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE BILL (BIF), CHICAGO WOMEN IN TRADES (CWIT) IS PROPOSING TO LAUNCH THE WOMEN IN THE INFRASTRUCTURE WORKFORCE INITIATIVE TO ACCELERATE STATE AND LOCAL EFFORTS TO INCREASE WOMEN'S INCLUSION AND EQUITY IN CONSTRUCTION-TRADES JOBS ON THESE PROJECTS. AS A RESULT OF THIS INITIATIVE, CWIT EXPECTS TO GROW THE PERCENT OF WOMEN ENTERING AND COMPLETING APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, BY INCREASING OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO WORK, RETAIN AND ADVANCE ON INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. 
THESE GOALS WILL BE MET AS A RESULT OF THE INITIATIVE SUPPORTING TEAMS IN 10 STATES AND MUNICIPALITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY WHO WILL WORK TO LEVERAGE EXPANDED RESOURCES TO SUPPORT PRE-APPRENTICESHIP TRAINING AND OTHER ESSENTIAL SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, AND STRONGER LEADERSHIP FROM APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS, UNIONS, AND CONTRACTORS FOR INCREASING THE NUMBER OF WOMEN PREPARED TO ENTER, FIND EQUITABLE AND RESPECTFUL WORKING CONDITIONS, AND SUCCEED IN THE SKILLED TRADES.  THE INITIATIVE WILL PROMOTE NATIONAL, REGIONAL AND LOCAL RETENTION MODELS THAT SUPPORT TRADESWOMEN WITH MENTORSHIP, PEER SUPPORT, GUIDANCE AND SKILL BUILDING TO ADVANCE IN SKILLED TRADE OCCUPATIONS. 


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
TO MEET THESE GOALS, THE WOMEN IN THE INFRASTRUCTURE WORKFORCE INITIATIVE WILL HELP TRADESWOMEN'S ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR ALLIES TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS MOMENT BY MOBILIZING COMMUNITY-BASED COLLABORATIVE TEAMS TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT WORKFORCE-EQUITY PLANS FOR BIF-FUNDED PROJECTS IN THEIR REGIONS. THE INITIATIVE IS GUIDED BY THE GOALS SET FORTH IN THE FRAMEWORK FOR PROMOTING WORKFORCE EQUITY AND INCLUSION FOR INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS (THE FRAMEWORK) DEVELOPED IN BY CWIT IN COLLABORATION WITH THE NATIONAL TASKFORCE ON TRADESWOMEN'S ISSUES. CWIT WILL PROMOTE THE ADOPTION OF THE TEN COMPONENTS OF THE FRAMEWORK AND GUIDE ITS IMPLEMENTATION IN NINE SELECT STATES AND METROPOLITAN AREAS ACROSS THE COUNTRY THAT INCLUDE NORTHERN CALIFORNIA, ILLINOIS, KANSAS, NEW ORLEANS- LA, NEW YORK CITY, CENTRAL OHIO, SAN ANTONIO-TEXAS, VERMONT, WEST VIRGINIA. THE INITIATIVE WILL SUPPORT TRADESWOMEN'S ORGANIZATIONS IN EACH OF THESE LOCALES TO JUMPSTART AND SPEARHEAD COLLABORATIVE TEAMS OF THE RELATED STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FUNDING INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AND CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS WHO WILL BE PERFORMING THE WORK. THESE TEAMS WILL INCLUDE TRADESWOMEN'S ADVOCATES AND OTHER KEY ALLIES, STAFF FROM THE AGENCY THAT WILL LET CONTRACTS FOR THE INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, AND STAFF FROM OTHER ALLIED AGENCIES OR ENTITIES SUCH AS KEY RAPS, UNIONS, AND CONTRACTORS WORKING TOGETHER TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRADESWOMEN AND OTHER UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS TO WORK ON INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.

DELIVERABLES
CWIT WILL HOLD A SUMMIT IN WASHINGTON, DC WHERE ALL OF THE COLLABORATIVE TEAMS OF TRADESWOMEN'S ADVOCATES AND OTHER KEY ALLIES FROM THE TEN IDENTIFIED AREAS WILL COME TOGETHER IN A PEER-LEARNING FORUM TO SHARE PLANS AND BEST PRACTICES AND TO ENGAGE WITH THE FEDERAL AGENCIES THAT ARE PROVIDING THE FUNDING FOR THE INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. THE SUMMIT PARTICIPANTS WILL ALSO INCLUDE FEDERAL PROCUREMENT OFFICERS FROM THE RELEVANT AGENCIES AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS SUCH AS INDUSTRY LEADERS, ELECTED OFFICIALS, FOUNDATIONS THAT ARE FUNDING INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUSION WORK, AND PEOPLE FROM NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS DOING RELATED WORK. 2. CWIT WILL SUPPORT THE TEAMS IN THEIR LOCALES FOLLOWING THE SUMMIT TO IMPLEMENT THE NEXT STEPS OF THE PLANS DEVELOPED AT THE SUMMIT. THIS WILL INCLUDE MEETINGS WITH KEY POLICYMAKERS, CONVENING STATE AGENCIES TO IDENTIFY RESOURCES AND COMMIT TO OVERSIGHT, DESIGN ONGOING STATE, MUNICIPAL OR PROJECT WIDE CAMPAIGNS TO PROMOTE, CREATE AND SUSTAIN INCLUSIVE AND DIVERSE INFRASTRUCTURE WORKSITES, PRESENTING THE EQUITY PLATFORM AT CONTRACTOR PRE-BID AND POST-AWARD CONFERENCES AND PROVIDING TRAINING/GUIDANCE ON INCLUDING EQUITY TO BIDDERS AND AWARDEES OF INFRASTRUCTURE CONTRACTS. 3. CWIT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS IN EACH TEN IDENTIFIED AREAS TO HELP THEM DEVELOP WORKFORCE-EQUITY PLANS, PROMOTE THEIR ADOPTION, AND PROVIDE ONGOING OVERSIGHT TO ENSURE EFFECTIVE IMPLEMENTATION. 4. CWIT WILL WORK WITH TEAM LEADERS AND THEIR PARTNERS TO BUILD THEIR CAPACITY TO PROVIDE INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS WITH RESOURCES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON POLICY AND PRACTICES TO ADDRESS RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF TRADESWOMEN, AND TRAININGS. 5. CWIT WILL WORK WITH THE TEAMS TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO PUBLIC AGENCY COMPLIANCE OFFICERS ON THE UNIQUE CHALLENGES FACED BY TRADESWOMEN, WORK WITH PUBLIC AGENCIES TO ESTABLISH REPORTING PROTOCOLS AND A PORTAL FOR PUBLIC REPORTING, AND TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF STAKEHOLDER EQUITY OVERSIGHT COMMITTEES TO MEET ON A MONTHLY OR QUARTERLY BASIS TO ASSESS PROGRESS, ADDRESS CHALLENGES TO ACHIEVING GOALS AND FOSTER ONGOING COLLABORATION.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
CWIT WILL PROMOTE THE ADOPTION OF THE TEN COMPONENTS OF THE FRAMEWORK AND GUIDE ITS IMPLEMENTATION IN NINE SELECT STATES AND METROPOLITAN AREAS ACROSS THE COUNTRY THAT INCLUDE NORTHERN CALIFORNIA, ILLINOIS, KANSAS, NEW ORLEANS- LA, NEW YORK CITY, CENTRAL OHIO, SAN ANTONIO-TEXAS, VERMONT, WEST VIRGINIA. THE INITIATIVE WILL SUPPORT TRADESWOMEN'S ORGANIZATIONS IN EACH OF THESE LOCALES TO JUMPSTART AND SPEARHEAD COLLABORATIVE TEAMS OF THE RELATED STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES FUNDING INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AND CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS WHO WILL BE PERFORMING THE WORK.
